results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 04: reset
results.creator_credit: Pioneer LDCE, Genco, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Haruyo Kanesaku, Ryutaro Nakamura, Johei Matsuura and Akihiko Nishiyama
results.brief_description: Finale of the animated Japanese series, “Lain”; Volume 04 “Reset”, episodes (layers) 11, 12 and 13. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 11, “Infornography”: in an increasingly disoriented existence, Lain is perplexed as to whether she exists at all. Episode 12, “Landscape”: realising she is a multiple presence, Lain struggles to comprehend the dark forces that are enabling the Wired to become connected to the real world. Episode 13, “Ego”: “Where is the real me?” asks Lain, in this final instalment of the series. If Lain deletes herself in the Wired, she may fail to exist at all. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 03: deus
results.creator_credit: Pioneer LDCE, Genco, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Haruyo Kanesaku, Ryutaro Nakamura, Johei Matsuura and Akihiko Nishiyama
results.brief_description: Continuation of the Japanese animated series “Lain”, Volume 03 “Deus”, episodes (layers) 8, 9 and 10. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 8, “Rumours in the Wired”: Lain reveals her aggressive alter ego whilst trying to ascertain whether there is a God. Meanwhile, Lain in the real world becomes increasingly frightened and attempts to wrestle control of her life. Episode 9, “Protocol”: in this episode the history of computers that lead to the establishment of the Wired is explained; Lain confronts Taro, suspecting that he is a Knight. Episode 10, “Love”: Lain comes face-to-face with God in the Wired. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 02: knights
results.creator_credit: Pioneer LDCE, Genco, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Haruyo Kanesaku, Ryutaro Nakamura, Johei Matsuura and Akihiko Nishiyama
results.brief_description: Continuation of the animated Japanese series, “Lain”, Volume 02 “Knights”, episodes (layers) 5, 6 and 7. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 5, “Distortion”: Lain receives communication from mysterious forces about the workings of the Wired, intensifying her powers within the cyber network. As her life becomes progressively stranger, Lain starts to question the bounds of reality as her sister is beset by visions and warnings to fulfil a mysterious prophecy. Episode 6, “Kids”: Lain discovers that a rash of teen suicides is connected to a game played in the Wired. Inured to the world of the Wired, Lain is increasingly isolated from the real world. Episode 7 “Society”: when Lain’s existence is threatened by the ‘Knights’, she enlists the help of the men in black who have been trailing her. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 01: Navi
results.creator_credit: Pioneer LDCE, Genco, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Haruyo Kanesaku, Ryutaro Nakamura, Johei Matsuura and Akihiko Nishiyama
results.brief_description: Japanese animated series “Lain”, Volume 01 “Navi”, episodes (layers) 1, 2, 3 and 4. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is startled to receive emails from a fellow classmate, Chisa, who has recently committed suicide. Chisa tells Lain about where she lives, “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. “Weird” Episode 1 (or layer one) establishes Lain’s isolation from her emotionally remote family, and her eagerness to form relationships in the cyber world when she fails to connect with those in the real world. Episode 2, “Girls”: Lain suspects she has an alternate personality operating on the Wired, an uncontrollable alter ego that is the opposite of her true self. When a killer, high on mind-altering drugs runs amok in a nightclub, Lain is mysteriously spared. Episode 3, “Psyche”: Lain is being trailed by several mysterious men in black and gets unusual mental communications regarding the set-up of the Wired. A package, enabling unencumbered access to The Wired, is anonymously delivered. Episode 4, “Religion”: now engrossed with cyberspace, Lain modifies her computer, gaining extensive access to the Wired. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Sergei Eisenstein 1898-1948
results.creator_credit: Moscow Central Studio of Documentary Films
results.brief_description: This film biography deals with the life and work of the classic Russian director, Sergei Mikhailovitch Eisenstein, 1989-1948. Extracts from some of his best known films including “Potemkin”, “Old and New”, “Ten Days that Shook the World” and “Ivan the Terrible”. Homage is paid to the director by Sergei Prokofiev, Gregori Alexandrov and Guiseppe de Santis.

results.title: Sergeant York
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jesse L Lasky, Hal B Wallis and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: He was a pacifist, turned patriot; a backwoods farmboy and ace Turkey Shoot champ who decided there are some things worth fighting for. Sergeant Alvin C. York became the renowned hero of World War I, capturing 132 German soldiers during the savage fighting in the Argonne. York insisted that if a film was to be made of his life, he wanted Gary Cooper only to play his character. This performance earned Cooper an Oscar. Under the direction of Howard Hawks, and with a cast that included Walter Brennan and Joan Leslie, this film will remain an all time classic.

results.title: Sergeant Swell of the Mounties
results.creator_credit: Pending Productions, Len Janson and Chuck Menville
results.brief_description: A spoof on the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in which our hero, Sergeant Swell, finds himself at odds with a local Indian tribe and a warrior who always seems to be just a few steps behind. Includes the ‘cliche’ lady in perpetual distress who requires continuous rescuing by the incompetent Swell.

results.title: Serenal
results.brief_description:
A vibrant fantasia of patterned sound in which Norman McLaren salutes the West Indies, painting the spirit of fiesta on film to the lively beat of an island tune by Trinidad’s Grand Curacaya Orchestra.
(Awards: San Sebastian; Bilbao; Bergamo.)

results.title: Serenade
results.creator_credit: Henry Blanke, Warner Bros Pictures and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: A musical feast for lovers of opera and fans of tenor Mario Lanza. Lanza plays Damon Vincenti, an unknown tenor who is plucked from obscurity when he is discovered by society patroness Kendall Hale (Joan Fontaine). With smooth impresario Charles Winthrop (Vincent Price) and voice teacher Maestro Marcatello (Joseph Calleia) behind him Vincenti is on the road to a great career as a tenor, but he becomes mesmerised by Kendall Hale. Hale has already had a string of heartbroken men who have been her pet projects in the past, and Damon is set to be her next victim. On the night of his debut at the New York Opera she drops him for her next protege. Damon is devastated and flees in the middle of his debut. He escapes to Mexico and is unable to sing. He is ‘rescued’ by Juana Montes (Sara Montiel) a fiery but patient Mexican girl whose father was a bull fighter. Eventually Damon marries Juana and they head back to America to restart his career. A showdown between the two women is set up as they fight over Vincenti. Fans of Lanza’s voice will appreciate the numerous songs he sings in this film, including “Serenade”,”Ave Maria” and “Nessun Dorma”.

results.title: Serama's mask
results.creator_credit: Deepa Saltzman, Paul Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”
Serama, a Balinese boy, has been learning the intricate, ancient art of the Balinese dance since he was seven. His teacher is his father, a master dancer. They practice for a dance that will be the father’s final performance, and mark his son as his replacement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deepa Saltzman, Paul Saltzman and Sunrise Films
